tabControls.name: name
tabControls.tooltip: The object's name; this is how it is identified in code. It can only contain letters, digits and underscores; it cannot start with a number.

tabControls.name: loc
tabControls.tooltip: Where the object is at the start of the game, the location or container. Should usually be blank for locations (as they are not inside anything).

tabControls.name: jsPronoun
tabControls.tooltip: How should the game refer to this?

tabControls.name: jsColour
tabControls.tooltip: Colour of the text in the left pane.

tabControls.name: jsIsZone
tabControls.tooltip: Zones are a way to group rooms, making it easier to build large maps (in fact, they are just rooms in a different colour).

tabControls.name: jsMobilityType
tabControls.tooltip: If the item never moves, it is immobile. If it can be taken by the player or a character, it is takeable.

tabControls.name: jsIsEdible
tabControls.tooltip: Can this item be eaten or drunk?

tabControls.name: jsIsCountable
tabControls.tooltip: An item is countable if there are several of them at a few locations, and they are to be grouped together.

tabControls.name: jsComments
tabControls.tooltip: Your notes; this will not be part of the game when you publish it.
